temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content: Brucella can grow at temperatures between 20 and 40°C. The optimal temperature for growth is between 34 and 37°C. Survival is longer when the temperature is low, even under negative temperatures.

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: Brucellae are considered as aerobic, but certain strains require a CO2 enriched atmosphere (5 to 10%) to grow under laboratory conditions. Recently, it has been reported that Brucella can survive in anoxic conditions.

ph.title: pH
ph.content: Brucella can grow with a pH between 5.8 and 8.7. Brucella can survive under medium (pH<4.5, in cheese or during intracellular infection) and extreme (pH<2,5, during stomach transit) acid conditions.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content: The growth of Brucella (B. abortus and B. melitensis) in the environment is promoted by humid conditions. Survival is highly dependent on the water availability.
